Detailed Description

A node in a station graph.

ChunkStationNode::LinkInfoConstIter ChunkStationNode::beginLinks (  )  const

This function returns an iterator representing the first of the links.

Returns:
An iterator that can iterate over the links.

void ChunkStationNode::beginMove (  )  [protected]

This is used to flag that the node is being moved.

bool ChunkStationNode::canTraverse ( UniqueID const &  other  )  const

This function returns true if you can traverse to the other node from this node.

Parameters:
other The other node.
Returns:
True if you can traverse from this node to other. Note that this can still return false if linked but the direction is not from this node to other.

ChunkLinkPtr ChunkStationNode::createLink (  )  const [protected, virtual]

This function is used to create a link.

Derived classes can override this to provide a more useful link type.

Returns:
A new link.

ChunkStationNode::LinkInfoConstIter ChunkStationNode::endLinks (  )  const

This function returns an iterator representing the one past the end of the links.

Returns:
An iterator that can iterate over the links.

void ChunkStationNode::endMove (  )  [protected]

This is used to flag that the node has been moved.

ChunkLinkPtr ChunkStationNode::findLink ( ChunkStationNode const *  other  )  const [protected]

This function finds a link to other.

Parameters:
other The node to find the link for.
Returns:
The link between the nodes. This will be NULL if there is no link.

ChunkStationNode::LinkInfoConstIter ChunkStationNode::findLink ( UniqueID const &  id  )  const

This function finds the link with the given id.

Returns:
An iterator to the given link. If there is no such link then endLinks is returned.

bool ChunkStationNode::load ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
Chunk *  pChunk 
)

This loads a ChunkStationNode from a DataSection.

Parameters:

pChunk The chunk the node will go into.
Returns:
True for a successful load.

bool ChunkStationNode::loadName ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
Chunk *  pChunk 
) [protected, virtual]

This function is used as part of the loading process.

It loads all data except links.

Parameters:
pSection The section to load from.
pChunk The chunk that the node will be placed into.

This function returns the number of links that the node has.

The number of links to/from the node.

void ChunkStationNode::removeLink ( ChunkStationNode *  other  )  [protected]

This function unlinks this node from other.

Parameters:

ChunkLinkPtr ChunkStationNode::setLink ( ChunkStationNode *  other,
bool  canTraverse 
)

This functions sets whether we can traverse to the other node.

A link is created if necessary. Note that calls to this function should be symmetric - you should also call other->setLink(this, blah).

Parameters:
other The other node to link to.
canTraverse Can we go from this node to other?
Returns:
The link from this to other.

void ChunkStationNode::toss ( Chunk *  chunk  )  [virtual]

This is called when the node is moved out of one chunk (and possibly into another.

Parameters:
chunk The new chunk for the node. This can be NULL if the node is being thrown out of memory.

Reimplemented from ChunkItem.

void ChunkStationNode::updateRegistration ( Chunk *  chunk  )  [protected]

This is used to make sure that the graph has the latest information about the node.

Parameters:
chunk The chunk that the node will be in.

This function sets the user string of the node.

Parameters:
